## Discussion

The window shows a documentation icon in the title bar when this property isn’t `nil` and the URL has a non-empty path. If the URL represents a filename or other resource with a known icon, the window displays that icon as the document icon; otherwise, the window displays a default document icon.

# representedURL

**Instance Property**

A URL of the file or resource represented in the window.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var representedURL: URL? { get set }
```

## Discussion

The window shows a documentation icon in the title bar when this property isn’t `nil` and the URL has a non-empty path. If the URL represents a filename or other resource with a known icon, the window displays that icon as the document icon; otherwise, the window displays a default document icon.

When the windows displays a document icon, a pop-up menu is also available by Command-clicking the area containing the icon and title. The pop-up menu displays the path components of the URL.

If [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITitlebar/representedURL] is `nil` or the URL path is empty, the document icon and pop-up menu aren’t available.

## Configuring the title bar

- **separatorStyle**: The type of separator that the app displays between the title bar and content of a window.
- **UITitlebarSeparatorStyle**: Styles that determine the type of separator displayed between the title bar and content of a window.
- **titleVisibility**: A value that indicates the visibility of the title.
- **UITitlebarTitleVisibility**: States that determine visibility of the title in the title bar.
